snippet: An analytical failure and a “glaring absence of political oversight” was compounded by a decline in Russia expertise and analysis, the report said.
abstract: House of Lords subcommittee condemns Britain and European Union for handling of crisis in Ukraine; say Europe failed to appreciate importance of Ukraine's relationship with Russia and that Britain did not live up to obligations in 1994 Budapest Memorandum.
lead_paragraph: An analytical failure and a “glaring absence of political oversight” was compounded by a decline in Russia expertise and analysis, the report said.

headline.main: Britain and Europe ‘Sleepwalked’ Into the Ukraine Crisis, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Britain and Europe ‘Sleepwalked’ Into the Ukraine Crisis, Report Says
